sentences.en: He confessed to having a secret admiration for his opponent.
sentences.cn: 他承认私底下很钦佩他的对手。

sentences.en: He had a chance to confess and expiate his guilt.
sentences.cn: 他有认错和赎罪的机会。

sentences.en: I am half ashamed to confess it.
sentences.cn: 承认这事我真有些羞愧.

sentences.en: I confess it with shame -- shrunk icily into myself, like a snail.
sentences.cn: 我羞愧地忏悔了 —— 冷冰冰地退缩, 像个蜗牛.

sentences.en: I confess it's got me baffled.
I confess to some suspicion of your honesty.
sentences.cn: 我承认对你的诚实有所怀疑.

sentences.en: I had expected her to confess that she only wrote these books for the money.
sentences.cn: 我本以为她会承认写这些书只是为了钱。

sentences.en: In the end he was driven to confess and face a prison sentence, feeling that to clear his conscience would be cheap at the price.
sentences.cn: 最终他被迫供认不讳,并面临判刑, 感到他要无愧于心,其代价再昂贵也是值得的.

sentences.en: Let us now confess our sins to Almighty God.
sentences.cn: 现在让我们向上帝忏悔我们的罪恶。

sentences.en: Many Christians regularly confess their guilty actions and thoughts to a priest.
sentences.cn: 很多基督徒都定期向牧师忏悔他们的罪行和恶念.

sentences.en: Marsha confessed that she didn’t really know how to work the computer.
sentences.cn: 玛莎承认自己其实并不会使用计算机。

sentences.en: Most people confess to a bad memory.
sentences.cn: 大多数人都承认记性差.

sentences.en: Occasionally people confess to crimes they haven’t committed just to get attention.
sentences.cn: 偶尔人们会承认自己并未犯过的罪行，那只是为了引人注意。

sentences.en: Right off I want to confess that I was wrong.
sentences.cn: 我立刻就想承认我错了。

sentences.en: They tortured the man to make him confess his crime.
sentences.cn: 他们拷打那个人,使他招认他的罪行.

sentences.en: They were very polite, I must confess.
sentences.cn: 我得承认他们很有礼貌。

sentences.en: Torture was used and Fian confessed.
sentences.cn: 酷刑用过之后菲安就招供了。

sentences.en: You just go to the church and confess your sins.
sentences.cn: 你干脆去教堂忏悔自己的罪过吧。

words.tran_cn: 公开承认地；明白供认地；自称地
忏悔者；为信教而被迫害的教徒

trans.tran_en: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

trans.tran_cn: 供认， 坦白； 承认
